intro: Malanea guaiquinimensis, commonly known as the Guaiquinimense Malanea, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Guadeloupe. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
